headline: Keto Cinnamon Granola
description: If you love something crunchy-sweet in the morning, this homemade keto cinnamon granola recipe is quick, easy, flavorful, and low in carbs.
name: Keto Cinnamon Granola
recipeIngredient: 2 teaspoons granulated erythritol sweetener (such as Swerve®)
1 (1 gram) packet granular sucrolose sweetener (such as Splenda®), or more to taste

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C).
Mix walnuts, pecans, coconut, and almonds together in a bowl.
Stir cinnamon, erythritol, and sucralose into melted butter; pour over nut mixture and stir to coat. Spread granola in a single layer on a baking sheet.
Bake in the preheated oven until crunchy, 8 to 10 minutes. Remove from oven; stir and allow to cool.

review.reviewBody: I loved it
Very good for. Keto snack! Easy to make and stores well
Very yummy with almond milk. Added extra stevia (Good Earth) packets & also a tsp of apple pie spices too. A nice Keto cereal to enjoy!
This is wonderful and sweet! Makes a great snack and also a good cereal. Very filling.

Flavor was great! Didnt turn out crunchy. Probably need to cook next batch longer.
Thx for sharing!

Love this! I used 1.5 cups raw tree nuts instead of walnuts, pecans and almonds. Used only Swerve Brown and no Splenda. Sprinkled with salt before baking. This was so good! Great as a snack, on yogurt, or on ice cream. My new go to low carb granola!
This is soooo easy and so good!
I added sugar free chocolate chips to make it a little sweeter. Very good. Will be making again.

This is a pretty good keto cereal. :-) I didn't have walnuts, though, so I did 1/2 cup of almonds instead of 1/3. I also used Stevia (the 1:1 ratio kind). I tried a little bit with coconut milk to see what it was like. Not bad. 

However, 8 - 10 min is definitely too long... I kept checking it, because I was afraid it was gonna burn. I ended up taking it out after 7 min, but I should have taken it out after 6. Some of the nuts started to burn. Next time, I'll take it out sooner. I'll also probably add a bit more Stevia. It suggests adding a little artificial sweetener, but that's not keto, so adding more natural non-sugar sweetener would be good. 

But yeah, it's a good keto cereal to have with almond or coconut milk.
Delicious!!! But you should look at the granola at about 6 or 7 minutes as the edges start to cook more than the middle. I stirred it up a bit and put it back in.... love it!
The coconut flakes are a great alternative to oats
I substituted with xylitol, turned out awesome - love the toasted nuts and coconut!

Incredible!! I loved this so much. The cinnamon is amazing with the nuts. I'm Paleo, so I substituted olive oil for the butter and 4 tsp. honey for the two artificial sweeteners. I will make this again very soon!
Not sure what I did wrong except used a convection oven which I should have reduced heat or time to accommodate for. Used stevia and cheated a little by adding a handful of low sugar craisins.
Nice for snacking. No need for extra sugar so I eliminated.
I made exactly as recipe first. Delicious! Great for Keto people missing cereal or snacking dry.

I added 1/4 cup each of flax seeds and chia seeds, which meant that I increased the butter mixture to: 3T melted butter, 1T pyure sweetener (stevia blend, measures twice as sweet as sugar), and 2tsp of cinnamon. Super yummy!
Easy and tasty!
I added some pumpkin, flax and sunflower seeds as well turned out great. Smells wonderful!
used whole almonds, pecans. Used Monk Fruit sweetener. All other ingredients as is. Good mix for low carb diets.

I usually don't review if I don't follow the recipe as listed, but there weren't any here, so I thought I would. I followed everything except for the sweeteners. I don't like artificial, and usually do without. I chose coconut sugar, 2 tsp for the whole batch (1g. Sugar per serving). This came out perfect. Crunchy, and just enough sweetness to bring out the cinnamon. I'll be keeping this recipe!
